apiKey.title: Configure Your AlphaGenome API Key
apiKey.description: To use this application, you need to provide your own AlphaGenome API key. The API is FREE for non-commercial research use.
apiKey.configuredDesc: Your API key is securely stored in your browser.
apiKey.howToGet: How to get your API key
apiKey.step2: Sign in with your Google account
apiKey.step3: Request an API key (usually instant approval)
apiKey.step4: Copy and paste your key below
apiKey.privacyDesc: Your API key is stored only in your browser (localStorage). It is never sent to our servers for storage. The key is only used when making requests to the AlphaGenome API.
apiKey.invalidKey: Please enter a valid API key

regionExplorer.title: Region Explorer
regionExplorer.description: Browse any genomic region and explore predictions across different cell types.
regionExplorer.browserDesc: Visualize predictions for RNA-seq, ATAC-seq, splicing, and more
regionExplorer.noDataYet: Enter a region and click Explore to visualize genomic data

batchAnalysis.title: Batch Analysis
batchAnalysis.description: Upload a VCF file to analyze multiple variants at once.

errors.invalidFile: Invalid file format. Please upload a VCF file.
errors.tooManyVariants: File contains more than 10,000 variants. Please split your file.
errors.parseError: Error parsing VCF file. Please check the format.
errors.analysisError: Error during analysis. Please try again.

learn.title: Genetics Academy
learn.description: Learn the basics of genetics and genomics in simple, interactive lessons.

dna.title: What is DNA?
dna.description: The basic building blocks of life
dna.content: DNA (Deoxyribonucleic Acid) is the molecule that carries genetic instructions for all living organisms. It's shaped like a twisted ladder called a double helix.

variants.title: Genetic Variants
variants.description: How single letter changes affect your body
variants.content: A genetic variant is a change in the DNA sequence. These can be as small as a single nucleotide (SNP) or as large as entire chromosome changes.

expression.title: Gene Expression
expression.content: Gene expression is the process by which information from a gene is used to create a functional product, usually a protein. This involves transcription and translation.

disease.title: Disease & Genetics
disease.content: Many diseases have a genetic component. Understanding your genetic variants can help assess your risk for certain conditions and guide preventive measures.

variant.title: Analyze Genetic Variant
variant.description: Enter a variant to predict its effect on gene expression, splicing, and more.
variant.configureKey: Please configure your API key first

results.showingOf: Showing {shown} of {total} genes. Download for full data.

geneExpression.title: Gene Expression
geneExpression.desc: Predict RNA-seq, CAGE, and PRO-cap signals to understand how variants affect gene expression levels.

chromatin.title: Chromatin Accessibility
chromatin.desc: Analyze DNase-seq and ATAC-seq predictions to identify regulatory regions affected by variants.

splicing.title: Splicing Effects
splicing.desc: Detect splice site creation/destruction, exon skipping, and changes in isoform usage.

histone.title: Histone Modifications
histone.desc: Predict effects on histone marks like H3K4me3, H3K27ac, and other epigenetic features.

tfBinding.title: TF Binding
tfBinding.desc: Identify transcription factor binding sites affected by genetic variants.

structure3d.title: 3D Genome Structure
structure3d.desc: Analyze contact maps to understand effects on TADs and long-range interactions.

useCases.title: What Can You Discover?
useCases.subtitle: From personal genetics to scientific research

myDna.title: My DNA Analysis
myDna.desc: Upload your 23andMe/Ancestry results and discover what your variants mean

familyRisk.title: Family Health
familyRisk.desc: Understand hereditary risk patterns in your family

superpowers.title: Genetic Superpowers
superpowers.desc: Discover variants associated with longevity, memory, and athletic performance

virtualLab.title: Virtual Lab
virtualLab.desc: Experiment with genetic mutations safely in a virtual environment

evolution.title: Evolution Simulator
evolution.desc: See how genetic changes affect traits across generations

detective.title: Disease Detective
detective.desc: Solve clinical cases by identifying causative variants

batchAnalysis.title: Batch Analysis
batchAnalysis.desc: Analyze thousands of variants from VCF files

drugTargets.title: Drug Targets
drugTargets.desc: Identify genes suitable for new therapeutic approaches

populations.title: Population Genetics
populations.desc: Compare genetic variation across human populations

footer.poweredBy: Powered by Google DeepMind AlphaGenome API
footer.citation: Citation: Avsec et al. "Advancing regulatory variant effect prediction with AlphaGenome" Nature 2026

featureRequest.smallTeamMessage: We are a small team with big dreams.
featureRequest.notPrioritized: This feature is on our list, but we haven't been able to prioritize it yet.
featureRequest.leaveEmail: If you need it, leave your email and we'll prioritize it for you.
featureRequest.notifyWhenReady: You'll receive an email when it's ready.
featureRequest.willNotify: We'll send you an email when this feature is ready.
featureRequest.noProgrammingNeeded: You don't need to know how to code. With the tools we'll teach you in a couple of hours and our work systems, you'll be able to contribute to making features like this a reality.

crispr.title: CRISPR Gene Editing Simulator

crispr.knockoutDesc: Disrupt gene function via NHEJ repair
crispr.correctionDesc: Fix mutation via HDR repair template
crispr.disclaimer: Educational simulation only. No actual genetic editing is performed.
